ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would say its basically a course on PET imaging. Its an introduction to the theory of it, as well as studies with drugs, mostly drugs of abuse. The professors are all extremely nice, the workload is more than manageable, and the experience is enjoyable. If you need rigid organization, though, this may not be the course for you.I would recommend it to another student only if they were interested in neuroimaging, particularly PET, or neurochemical systems, particularly dopamine.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I was exposed to a new method of neuroimaging, which opened my eyes to what can be accomplished as far as neurotransmitter systems go. I can think of several studies I would be interested in pursuing using PET imaging.
Helped clear fundamentals about PET principles and strategies.
